law.text:
As used in this section and KRS 304.17A-162, unless the context requires otherwise:
"Contracted pharmacy" or "pharmacy" means a pharmacy located in Kentucky participating in the network of a pharmacy benefit manager through a direct contract or through a contract with a pharmacy services administration organization or group purchasing organization;
"Drug product reimbursement" means the amount paid by a pharmacy benefit manager to a contracted pharmacy for the cost of the drug dispensed to a patient and does not include a dispensing or professional fee; and
"Pharmacy benefit manager" means an entity that contracts with pharmacies on behalf of a health benefit plan, state agency, insurer, managed care organization, or other third-party payor to provide pharmacy health benefit services or administration.
law.history: Created 2013 Ky. Acts ch. 109, sec. 1, effective June 25, 2013.
